description: @module Dialog The `Dialog` component is a utility that is used by [Popover](#Popover), [Modal](#Modal) and [Tray](#Tray) for keyboard accessibility. Elements outside of the `Dialog` are hidden from screen readers automatically when `shouldContainFocus` is set to `true` or `screenreader`. The `liveRegion` prop can be used to specify any elements that should not be hidden. - ```js class Example extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { open: false } } render() { return ( this._firstName} shouldReturnFocus onDismiss={() => this.setState({ open: false })} > this.setState({ open: false })} screenReaderLabel="Close" /> Full name } layout="columns" > (this._firstName = c)} /> ) } } render() ``` - ```js const Example = () => { const [open, setOpen] = useState(false) return ( this._firstName} shouldReturnFocus onDismiss={() => setOpen(false)} > setOpen(false)} screenReaderLabel="Close" /> Full name } layout="columns" > (this._firstName = c)} /> ) } render() ``` ### Guidelines ```js --- type: embed --- ```

children.description: The children to be rendered within the `<Dialog />`

as.description: The element to render as the component root, `span` by default

label.description: The aria-label to read for screen reader.

open.description: Whether or not the `<Dialog />` is open

onBlur.description:
Function called when tab focus leaves the focusable content. This only
occurs when `shouldContainFocus` is set to false.

defaultFocusElement.description: An element or a function returning an element to focus by default

contentElement.description: An element or a function returning an element that wraps the content of the `<Dialog />`

tsType.name: union
tsType.raw:
| Node
| Window
| ReactElement
| Component
| (() => Node | Window | null | undefined)
| null

liveRegion.description:
An element, function returning an element, or array of elements that will not be hidden from
the screen reader when the focus region is active

shouldContainFocus.description:
When set to true, or it is an array that includes the 'keyboard' string,
the keyboard and screenreader focus is trapped; when set to 'screenreader'
only the screenreader focus is trapped.

shouldReturnFocus.description:
When set to true the keyboard focus is returned to the active element
before the focus region was activated.

shouldCloseOnDocumentClick.description:
When set to true the `onDismiss` function is called on a click outside
the focus region.

shouldCloseOnEscape.description:
When set to true the `onDismiss` function is called on the `Escape`
keypress

shouldFocusOnOpen.description: When set to true, the `defaultFocusElement` is focused on initialization.

elementRef.description: provides a reference to the underlying html root element
